issue.title: build: Make lint-locale-dependence.sh work with BSD grep (avoid empty subexpressions)
issue.body:
Make `lint-locale-dependence.sh` work with BSD `grep` by avoiding empty subexpressions.

macOS High Sierra:

```
$ grep --version
grep (BSD grep) 2.5.1-FreeBSD
$ echo foo | grep -E '^foo(_r|_s)?$'
foo
$ echo foo | grep -E '^foo(|_r|_s)$'
grep: empty (sub)expression
```

Ubuntu 18.04 LTS:

```
$ grep --version
grep (GNU grep) 3.1
$ echo foo | grep -E '^foo(_r|_s)?$'
foo
$ echo foo | grep -E '^foo(|_r|_s)$'
foo
```

Reported by @masonicboom in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13708#discussion_r203791916. Thanks!

events.body: utACK b5f1c28bc7d875681ce5f74ea8e32d601c2557b2, but should wait for the nit
ping @masonicboom, please either update for the nit or reject it

<!--5d09a71f8925f3f132321140b44b946d-->The last travis run for this pull request was 50 days ago and is thus outdated. To trigger a fresh travis build, this pull request should be closed and re-opened.

issue.title: docs: Document lint tests
issue.body:
Replaces #13708.
Fixed the macOS nit, and added `codespell` as a requirement.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -3,17 +3,18 @@ utilities in their entirety. It does not contain unit tests, which
 can be found in [/src/test](/src/test), [/src/wallet/test](/src/wallet/test),
 etc.
 
-There are currently two sets of tests in this directory:
+There are currently three sets of tests in this directory:
comments.body: nit: how about "the following" - the number isn't particularly important

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -180,6 +181,28 @@ Note: gdb attach step may require `sudo`
 Util tests can be run locally by running `test/util/bitcoin-util-test.py`. 
 Use the `-v` option for verbose output.
 
+### Lint tests
+
+#### Dependencies
+
+The lint tests require a python library called flake8. To install it: `pip3 install flake8`.
+
+#### Running the tests
+
+Individual tests can be run by directly calling the test script, eg:

@@ -180,6 +181,28 @@ Note: gdb attach step may require `sudo`
 Util tests can be run locally by running `test/util/bitcoin-util-test.py`. 
 Use the `-v` option for verbose output.
 
+### Lint tests
+
+#### Dependencies
+
+The lint tests require a python library called flake8. To install it: `pip3 install flake8`.
+
+#### Running the tests
+
+Individual tests can be run by directly calling the test script, eg:
+
+```
+test/lint/lint-filenames.sh
+```
+
+You can run all the shell-based lint tests by running:
+
+```
+test/lint/lint-all.sh
+```
+
+NOTE: on macOS you may receive warnings like `grep: empty (sub)expression`. To fix, install GNU grep.
comments.body: Which scripts trigger this? We should try to fix that.

comments.body:
lint-locale-dependence.sh. These two lines have this group expression which triggers it `(|_r|_s)`:

https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/test/lint/lint-locale-dependence.sh#L202
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/test/lint/lint-locale-dependence.sh#L206
